DOC.brief_summary: The overall goal observational study examine age-related habitual exercise train status-related difference structural functional change human brain , detect magnetic resonance ( MR ) imaging .
DOC.detailed_description: Normal age reduces cerebral blood flow , brain volume , cognitive function , thereby increase risk dementia Alzheimer 's disease . Aging associate increased white matter hyperintensities ( WMH ) appear alter functional connectivity within brain associate cognitive function ( reference ) . Observational study suggest regular physical activity associate improved cognitive function higher cerebral blood flow 1,2 . However , unknown age exercise training status alters structural functional biomarkers predictive cognitive decline . Thus , overall goal project examine age-related exercise training status-related difference structural functional change brain , detect magnetic resonance ( MR ) imaging . 1 . To determine white matter hyperintensities MRI scan brain alter age exercise training status . 2 . To determine interaction age habitual physical activity functional connectivity brain .
DOC.criteria: Between 1835 5575 Body mass index < 34 kg/m2 Physically active ( exercise 3 time per week least 30 min ) sedentary ( formal exercise 1 hour per week ) Current smoker History evidence : hepatic disease , renal disease , hematological disease , peripheral vascular disease , stroke/neurovascular disease , diabetes , hypertension Part vulnerable population ( e.g . pregnant woman , prisoner , individual lack capacity consent , etc . )
